title: [bug][alpha] cannot use same name for multiple cacheGroups
body:
<!-- Please don't delete this template because we'll close your issue -->
<!-- Before creating an issue please make sure you are using the latest version of webpack. -->

# Bug report

<!-- Please ask questions on StackOverflow or the webpack Gitter. -->
<!-- https://stackoverflow.com/questions/ask?tags=webpack -->
<!-- https://gitter.im/webpack/webpack -->
<!-- Issues which contain questions or support requests will be closed. -->
As it stated in the title, if you use same "name" option for multiple cacheGroups webpack will fail with error like:
`some-module.js has no id. This should not happen.`

**What is the current behavior?**
there is an error which is not allowing you to compile

**If the current behavior is a bug, please provide the steps to reproduce.**
repo with example - https://github.com/MhMadHamster/webpack-no-module-id

<!-- A great way to do this is to provide your configuration via a GitHub repository -->
<!-- The most helpful is a minimal reproduction with instructions on how to reproduce -->
<!-- Repositories with too many files or large `webpack.config.js` files are not suitable -->
<!-- Please only add small code snippets directly into this issue -->
<!-- https://gist.github.com is a good place for longer code snippets -->
<!-- If your issue is caused by a plugin or loader, please create an issue on the loader/plugin repository instead -->

**What is the expected behavior?**
No error should occur, there is no info about changing this behavior in the changelog for alpha.

<!-- "It should work" is not a helpful explanation -->
<!-- Explain exactly how it should behave -->

**Other relevant information:**
I believe this is a regression after v5.0.0-alpha.12 (error starts to occur in 12, alpha 11 works just fine), to be more exact i'm talking about these changes:  https://github.com/webpack/webpack/commit/b66143f706112ee56df2b67361f49aa05d9dbc24#diff-64e8e63f33596df33d814452fa5d5b83R882 I've tried to remove it and it leads to getting same error, but if you have entry and chunkGroup with the same name (currently it will show you WebpackError and will not throw an error, allowing to compile) corresponding test: test/configCases/split-chunks/entry-point-error will fail. I managed to fix this behavior by adding additional check if given chunk is an entrypoint, but i am not sure if this is right fix to do, i haven't found original commit for these changes, and it clearly not from the stable version (even tho on github it shows as a part of v4.30 merge to next), in my perspective if this code is only for case when user makes an entrypoint and a cacheGroup with the same name, which is not allowed in v5 already, why not just throw an error earlier not allowing to compile with this configuration, i guess for backward compatibility?

webpack version:  v5.0.0-alpha.16
Node.js version: v10.15.3
Operating System: windows 10
Additional tools: webpack-cli v3.3.4
